Board In Pictures Webcams I Love NY Faith Students RaW Blast CSV Interaction BBC Radio York Site Map Contact Us Like this page? Send it to a friend! End of GLOBAL NAVIGATION #BeginEditable "top" Plunkets Restaurant, York #EndEditable #BeginEditable "image and lead text" Reading 
                  this? Why don't you write us a review? Plunkets 
                    Restaurant Steve Chris Joe Helen Claire #EndEditable #BeginEditable "story data" #EndEditable #BeginEditable "body of story" Restaurant Plunketts Snouts Reviewer Steve Date 10-May-2006 Where 
                  is it? York What's 
                  the number? 01904 
                  637722 What's 
                  the grub like, then?

Ordered 
                    nachos as starters which they forgot to bring until the main 
                    course. Fajitas were only average. I was expecting them to 
                    arrive sizzling hot but they weren't so the food was only 
                    lukewarm.

What 
                  did you drink? Bottle 
                  of house white at about 13 was okay. What's 
                  the crowd like? Arrived 
                  about 7pm on a Monday night so had a choice of tables. Got quite 
                  full later on. And 
                  the vibe? Nice 
                  building but tables were a bit cramped and the chairs uncomfortable. 
                  The couple at the next table started smoking so it was time 
                  to skip dessert and coffee and leave. Anything 
                  else you'd like to say? Overall 
                  disappointing. Seem to be trading on reputation alone. There 
                  are plenty of better options in York. Value 
                  for money? 53 
                  for 3 mains and wine. They didn't charge for the starters. Restaurant Plunkets Snouts Reviewer Chris Date 03-March-2006 Where 
                  is it? York What's 
                  the number? No 
                  need! They don't take bookings! What's 
                  the grub like, then?

If 
                    I was being generous I'd say it was fair. However, if I was 
                    more honest, I'd say overrated. But my problem wasn't with 
                    the food.

What 
                  did you drink? Bottled 
                  beer and house wine. Slightly pricey, but tasted nice. What's 
                  the crowd like? Couples 
                  of all ages. And 
                  the vibe? Crowded 
                  and smokey upstairs Anything 
                  else you'd like to say? Was 
                  told you cant book, so turned up without a reservation and 
                  had to wait two hours for a table. When we were finally seated, 
                  we noticed many tables were unused. Upstairs the bar was packed 
                  full of people waiting for tables and downstairs there were 
                  LOTS of tables unused? I got the feeling they were just ushering 
                  customers upstairs for an hour or two to get a few extra rounds 
                  of drinks out of them. Very annoying! Not in a rush to return! Value 
                  for money? I 
                  paid 8 for a plate of nachos chips with a couple of dollops 
                  of salsa for a starter. Restaurant Plunketts Snouts Reviewer Joe Date 02-January-2006 Where 
                  is it? York 
                  between the Art Gallery and the Minster What's 
                  the number? Don't 
                  book, enjoy the bar! (01904 637722) What's 
                  the grub like, then?

Plunketts 
                    is part of a Christmas tradition with us. We first visited 
                    years ago and have returned regularly (always at Christmas 
                    time) on our (at least) biennial shopping visit to York. The 
                    food is always excellent and the steaks are cooked just how 
                    you order them. I can also speak very highly of the 'bowl'o'red'! 
                    This time round we tried the Christmas cake and Godminster 
                    for dessert, and for a strictly Cheddar-only man like me this 
                    was a real treat - Fantastic! However having since purchased 
                    some of the aforementioned cheese I have been disappointed 
                    not to be able to achieve the same kick.

What 
                  did you drink? Black 
                  Sheep. Its as much a part of the tradition as admiring the view 
                  through the bedsit window across the street from upstairs, or 
                  banging my head on the low beams. What's 
                  the crowd like? Sadly 
                  the clientele appear to be getting younger; I say 'appear' because 
                  I am a realist and suspect that age wise I now have more in 
                  common with the fabric of the building than some of the punters! And 
                  the vibe? Soapbox 
                  time! Apart from it's everpresent inbuilt charm and ambience, 
                  on this occassion I was put off (upstairs at least) by the fug 
                  of smoke. The truth is I don't often get out these days and 
                  to have an evening as special as this marred (not exactly spoiled) 
                  by something as blatantly antisocial (its only social to those 
                  who enjoy it) was a tad upsetting. No doubting where I stand 
                  on the great debate then! Anything 
                  else you'd like to say? If 
                  you should visit in the week before Christmas be sure to have 
                  a seat next to the roaring fire! Only my wife likes to sit next 
                  to the window in the bar to see the Minster - so do I, of course! Value 
                  for money? Always! 
                  We shared the dessert and still couldn't manage it! Restaurant Plunkets Snouts Reviewer Helen Date 17-May-2005 Where 
                  is it? York What's 
                  the number? 01904 
                  637722 What's 
                  the grub like, then?

Amazing! 
                    The fajitas were fantasic and the portion was more than enough 
                    for one person.

What 
                  did you drink? the 
                  house white is cheap and fruity What's 
                  the crowd like? The 
                  service was spot on no faults at all And 
                  the vibe? chilled 
                  out atmosphere and the pictures of all the famous people really 
                  amazing. Anything 
                  else you'd like to say? Overall 
                  it was great, i will reccomend it to all my friends and will 
                  certainly go again! Value 
                  for money? It 
                  is about 4.50 for a starter and 10.00 ish for a main, well 
                  worth it though! Restaurant Plunkets Snouts Reviewer Claire Date 17-May-2005 Where 
                  is it? High 
                  Petergate, York What's 
                  the number? 01904 
                  637722 What's 
                  the grub like, then?

Fanastic. 
                    Wide choice and variety. Took a long time to decide what to 
                    order!

What 
                  did you drink? House 
                  white, very nice. What's 
                  the crowd like? We 
                  booked for mid afternoon so quiet. A few couples, work parties. And 
                  the vibe? Trendy, 
                  I could go with a partner or friends. I think it has the right 
                  setting to make the atmosphere what you want. Lots of pictures 
                  of famous stars everywhere, great. Anything 
                  else you'd like to say? Will 
                  definately be going again. Staff were friendly and the food 
                  exceptional. Value 
                  for money? For 
                  7; 3 courses and drinks it came to 180 which was good value 
                  for money. Each course was a generous portion only just had 
                  enough room for desert. Been 
                  inspired? Write a Greedy 
                  Pig grub review yourself! #EndEditable Top | Greedy 
                  Pig Index | Home

Farewell from the Greedy Pig We're sorry to announce that the Greedy Pig has eaten one wafer thin 
        mint too many and looks unlikely to recover so this section of the BBC 
        North Yorkshire website is now closed. Many thanks to everyone who submitted 
        reviews. Existing reviews will remain on this site for a while as an archive, 
        but won't be updated.
